description: Comprehensive test cases for Alberta Stroke Program Early CT Score calculator covering all 10 brain regions, score ranges, time windows, and clinical patterns
sources: Barber PA, et al. Lancet. 2000;355(9216):1670-1674 (Original ASPECTS)
Powers WJ, et al. Stroke. 2019;50:e344-e418 (AHA/ASA Guidelines)
Nogueira RG, et al. N Engl J Med. 2018;378:11-21 (DAWN Trial)
Albers GW, et al. N Engl J Med. 2018;378:708-718 (DEFUSE-3 Trial)
Sarraj A, et al. N Engl J Med. 2023;388:1259-1271 (SELECT2)
Huo X, et al. N Engl J Med. 2023;388:1272-1283 (ANGEL-ASPECT)

testCases.description: Normal CT with no early ischemic changes - ideal thrombectomy candidate

expectedOutputs.Interpretation: Small or no early ischemic changes
expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Within standard 6-hour window for thrombectomy - Standard eligibility criteria met (per 2015 landmark trials)
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Normal ASPECTS (10/10) - No early ischemic changes visible on NCCT. Note: Subtle changes may be missed within first 3 hours of symptom onset
expectedOutputs.Guideline Thresholds: Standard EVT: ASPECTS >= 6 (2019 AHA/ASA) | Large Core EVT: ASPECTS 3-5 (SELECT2, ANGEL-ASPECT, RESCUE-Japan LIMIT 2022-2023)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Count affected regions (0 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 0 = 10. Step 3: Score >= 8 indicates small/no changes. Step 4: Time 2h within 6h window.
testCases.medicalReference: Barber PA, et al. Lancet 2000 - ASPECTS 10 indicates no early ischemic changes

testCases.description: Hyperacute stroke (<1 hour) with no CT changes yet visible

expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Within standard 6-hour window for thrombectomy - Standard eligibility criteria met (per 2015 landmark trials)
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Normal ASPECTS (10/10) - No early ischemic changes visible on NCCT. Note: Subtle changes may be missed within first 3 hours of symptom onset

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: All 10 regions normal. Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 0 = 10. Step 3: 0.5h is hyperacute - CT changes may not yet be visible.
testCases.medicalReference: CT changes typically become visible 1-3 hours after stroke onset

testCases.description: Classic early sign of MCA stroke - loss of insular ribbon

expectedOutputs.Interpretation: Small or no early ischemic changes

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Insular cortex affected (1 region). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 1 = 9. Step 3: Score >= 8, favorable for EVT.
testCases.medicalReference: Insular ribbon sign is one of the earliest and most sensitive CT findings in MCA stroke

testCases.description: Early ischemic change in lentiform nucleus only

expectedOutputs.Interpretation: Small or no early ischemic changes

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Lentiform nucleus affected (1 region). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 1 = 9.
testCases.medicalReference: Lentiform nucleus is supplied by lenticulostriate arteries from proximal MCA

testCases.testName: ASPECTS 8 - Insular and lentiform (proximal M1 pattern)
testCases.description: Classic proximal M1 occlusion pattern with poor collaterals

expectedOutputs.Interpretation: Small or no early ischemic changes
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Involvement of both insular ribbon and lentiform nucleus suggests proximal M1 occlusion with poor collaterals

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Lentiform + Insular affected (2 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 2 = 8. Step 3: Pattern suggests proximal M1 occlusion.
testCases.medicalReference: Combined insular-lentiform involvement is highly specific for proximal M1 segment occlusion

testCases.testName: ASPECTS 8 - Caudate and internal capsule (lenticulostriate territory)
testCases.description: Lenticulostriate artery territory infarction pattern

expectedOutputs.Interpretation: Small or no early ischemic changes
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Caudate and internal capsule involvement may indicate lenticulostriate artery territory infarction

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Caudate + Internal capsule affected (2 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 2 = 8. Step 3: Pattern indicates lenticulostriate territory.
testCases.medicalReference: Lenticulostriate arteries supply caudate, lentiform nucleus, and internal capsule

testCases.testName: ASPECTS 7 - Moderate changes within standard window
testCases.description: Three cortical regions affected at ganglionic level

expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: May benefit from mechanical thrombectomy (meets standard threshold of ASPECTS >= 6)
expectedOutputs.Prognostic Implication: Moderate prognosis; treatment benefit supported by 2015 landmark trials (MR CLEAN, ESCAPE, SWIFT PRIME)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: M1 + M2 + M3 affected (3 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 3 = 7. Step 3: Score >= 6, meets EVT threshold.
testCases.medicalReference: ASPECTS >= 6 was inclusion criterion for landmark 2015 EVT trials (MR CLEAN, ESCAPE, SWIFT PRIME)

testCases.testName: ASPECTS 6 - Threshold for standard thrombectomy eligibility
testCases.description: Four regions affected - at threshold for standard EVT criteria

expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: May benefit from mechanical thrombectomy (meets standard threshold of ASPECTS >= 6)
expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Within standard 6-hour window for thrombectomy - Standard eligibility criteria met (per 2015 landmark trials)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: L + I + M1 + M2 affected (4 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 4 = 6. Step 3: At threshold for standard EVT.
testCases.medicalReference: AHA/ASA 2019 Guidelines: ASPECTS >= 6 for standard EVT eligibility

testCases.description: Moderate changes in extended time window - DEFUSE-3 criteria applicable

expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Extended window (6-16 hours): DEFUSE-3 criteria may apply
expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: May benefit from mechanical thrombectomy (meets standard threshold of ASPECTS >= 6)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: C + L + I + M1 affected (4 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 4 = 6. Step 3: 10h is within DEFUSE-3 window (6-16h). Step 4: ASPECTS 6 meets DEFUSE-3 threshold.
testCases.medicalReference: DEFUSE-3 Trial (Albers 2018): EVT benefit 6-16h with perfusion mismatch, ASPECTS >= 6

testCases.description: Moderate changes in late extended window - DAWN criteria applicable

expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Extended window (6-24 hours): DAWN trial criteria may apply - Requires clinical-imaging mismatch assessment

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: L + IC + I + M2 affected (4 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 4 = 6. Step 3: 20h within DAWN window (6-24h). Step 4: Requires mismatch assessment.
testCases.medicalReference: DAWN Trial (Nogueira 2018): EVT benefit 6-24h with clinical-core mismatch

testCases.testName: ASPECTS 5 - Large core, standard window (SELECT2 eligible)
testCases.description: Large ischemic core within 6 hours - recent large core trial eligible

expectedOutputs.Regions Affected: 5 region(s): C (Caudate), L (Lentiform), IC (Internal Capsule), I (Insular), M1
expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: Consider thrombectomy based on recent large core trials (SELECT2, ANGEL-ASPECT, RESCUE-Japan LIMIT)
expectedOutputs.Prognostic Implication: Higher risk of symptomatic hemorrhage, but EVT still shows benefit in recent RCTs
expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Within standard 6-hour window for thrombectomy - Large core: consider SELECT2/ANGEL-ASPECT criteria

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: C + L + IC + I + M1 affected (5 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 5 = 5. Step 3: Large core but within SELECT2/ANGEL-ASPECT criteria.
testCases.medicalReference: SELECT2 Trial (Sarraj 2023): EVT benefit with ASPECTS 3-5 (large core)

testCases.description: All subcortical structures plus one cortical region affected

expectedOutputs.Regions Affected: 5 region(s): C (Caudate), L (Lentiform), IC (Internal Capsule), I (Insular), M4
expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: Consider thrombectomy based on recent large core trials (SELECT2, ANGEL-ASPECT, RESCUE-Japan LIMIT)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: All 4 subcortical regions + M4 affected (5 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 5 = 5.
testCases.medicalReference: Complete subcortical involvement indicates extensive lenticulostriate territory infarction

testCases.description: Extensive ischemic changes with six regions involved

expectedOutputs.Regions Affected: 6 region(s): C (Caudate), L (Lentiform), I (Insular), M1, M2, M3
expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: Consider thrombectomy based on recent large core trials (SELECT2, ANGEL-ASPECT, RESCUE-Japan LIMIT)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: C + L + I + M1 + M2 + M3 affected (6 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 6 = 4. Step 3: Large core, EVT still considered per 2023 trials.
testCases.medicalReference: ANGEL-ASPECT Trial (Huo 2023): EVT benefit demonstrated in ASPECTS 3-5

testCases.testName: ASPECTS 3 - Lower threshold for large core EVT
testCases.description: Seven regions affected - at lower threshold for recent large core trials

expectedOutputs.Regions Affected: 7 region(s): C (Caudate), L (Lentiform), IC (Internal Capsule), I (Insular), M1, M2, M3
expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: Consider thrombectomy based on recent large core trials (SELECT2, ANGEL-ASPECT, RESCUE-Japan LIMIT)
expectedOutputs.Prognostic Implication: Higher risk of symptomatic hemorrhage, but EVT still shows benefit in recent RCTs

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: All subcortical (4) + all ganglionic cortical (3) = 7 regions. Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 7 = 3. Step 3: At lower bound for SELECT2/ANGEL criteria.
testCases.medicalReference: SELECT2 included ASPECTS 3-5; ANGEL-ASPECT included ASPECTS 3-5

testCases.testName: ASPECTS 3 - Extended window with large core
testCases.description: Large core in extended window - note DEFUSE-3 excluded ASPECTS < 6

expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Extended window (6-16 hours): DEFUSE-3 criteria may apply - Note: DEFUSE-3 excluded ASPECTS < 6
expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: Consider thrombectomy based on recent large core trials (SELECT2, ANGEL-ASPECT, RESCUE-Japan LIMIT)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: 7 regions affected. Step 2: ASPECTS = 3. Step 3: 12h in extended window but DEFUSE-3 excluded ASPECTS < 6.
testCases.medicalReference: DEFUSE-3 inclusion criterion was ASPECTS >= 6; large core trials had 24h window

testCases.description: Eight regions affected - beyond current trial eligibility thresholds

expectedOutputs.Regions Affected: 8 region(s): C (Caudate), L (Lentiform), IC (Internal Capsule), I (Insular), M1, M2, M3, M4
expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: Historically excluded from EVT trials; emerging data suggests some patients may benefit (individualized decision)
expectedOutputs.Prognostic Implication: Poor prognosis; high risk of hemorrhagic transformation; consider goals of care discussion

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: 8 regions affected. Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 8 = 2. Step 3: Below SELECT2/ANGEL thresholds. Step 4: Individualized decision required.
testCases.medicalReference: ASPECTS 0-2 historically excluded from RCTs; limited evidence for EVT benefit

testCases.description: Nine regions affected - extensive infarction

expectedOutputs.Regions Affected: 9 region(s): C (Caudate), L (Lentiform), IC (Internal Capsule), I (Insular), M1, M2, M3, M4, M5
expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: Historically excluded from EVT trials; emerging data suggests some patients may benefit (individualized decision)
expectedOutputs.Prognostic Implication: Poor prognosis; high risk of hemorrhagic transformation; consider goals of care discussion

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: 9 of 10 regions affected. Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 9 = 1. Step 3: Very large core with poor prognosis.
testCases.medicalReference: Very low ASPECTS associated with high mortality and morbidity regardless of treatment

testCases.description: All 10 regions affected - complete MCA territory involvement

expectedOutputs.Regions Affected: 10 region(s): C (Caudate), L (Lentiform), IC (Internal Capsule), I (Insular), M1, M2, M3, M4, M5, M6
expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: Historically excluded from EVT trials; emerging data suggests some patients may benefit (individualized decision)
expectedOutputs.Prognostic Implication: Poor prognosis; high risk of hemorrhagic transformation; consider goals of care discussion
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Complete cortical MCA involvement suggests very poor collateral circulation

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: All 10 regions affected. Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 10 = 0. Step 3: Complete MCA territory infarction with poor collaterals.
testCases.medicalReference: ASPECTS 0 indicates complete MCA territory early ischemic changes

testCases.description: All cortical regions affected with spared subcortical structures

expectedOutputs.Regions Affected: 6 region(s): M1, M2, M3, M4, M5, M6
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Complete cortical MCA involvement suggests very poor collateral circulation

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: All 6 cortical regions (M1-M6) affected. Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 6 = 4. Step 3: Complete cortical involvement pattern.
testCases.medicalReference: Pure cortical involvement with subcortical sparing may indicate M2 division occlusion

testCases.description: Three subcortical regions with no cortical involvement - lenticulostriate territory

expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Predominantly subcortical involvement - consider lenticulostriate territory infarction

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: C + L + IC affected (3 subcortical regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 3 = 7. Step 3: Pattern suggests lenticulostriate territory.
testCases.medicalReference: Lenticulostriate infarction may occur with M1 occlusion or perforator disease

testCases.description: Only supraganglionic cortical regions affected

expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: May benefit from mechanical thrombectomy (meets standard threshold of ASPECTS >= 6)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: M4 + M5 + M6 affected (3 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 10 - 3 = 7.
testCases.medicalReference: Isolated supraganglionic involvement may indicate distal M2/M3 branch occlusion

testCases.description: Beyond all standard thrombectomy time windows

expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Beyond standard thrombectomy time windows (>24 hours)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: 3 regions affected. Step 2: ASPECTS = 7. Step 3: 30h exceeds all standard EVT windows.
testCases.medicalReference: No RCT evidence for EVT benefit beyond 24 hours from symptom onset

testCases.description: At exact boundary between standard and extended windows

expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Within standard 6-hour window for thrombectomy - Standard eligibility criteria met (per 2015 landmark trials)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: I + M1 affected (2 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 8. Step 3: 6h is within standard window (<=6h).
testCases.medicalReference: Standard EVT window is 0-6 hours from symptom onset

testCases.description: At boundary of DEFUSE-3 window (6-16 hours)

expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Extended window (6-16 hours): DEFUSE-3 criteria may apply

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: L + I + M2 affected (3 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 7. Step 3: 16h is within DEFUSE-3 window (<=16h).
testCases.medicalReference: DEFUSE-3 Trial: EVT window 6-16 hours with perfusion mismatch

testCases.description: At boundary of DAWN trial window (6-24 hours)

expectedOutputs.Time Window Assessment: Extended window (6-24 hours): DAWN trial criteria may apply - Requires clinical-imaging mismatch assessment

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: C + I + M1 + M2 affected (4 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 6. Step 3: 24h is within DAWN window (<=24h).
testCases.medicalReference: DAWN Trial: EVT window 6-24 hours with clinical-core mismatch

testCases.description: Calculator behavior when laterality is not selected
testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: L + I affected (2 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 8. Step 3: No laterality specified - field omitted from output.
testCases.medicalReference: Laterality is clinical context, not part of ASPECTS calculation

testCases.description: Calculator behavior when time is not provided

expectedOutputs.Thrombectomy Eligibility: May benefit from mechanical thrombectomy (meets standard threshold of ASPECTS >= 6)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: C + L + I + M1 affected (4 regions). Step 2: ASPECTS = 6. Step 3: No time specified - time-related fields omitted.
testCases.medicalReference: Time from onset is optional context for treatment window assessment

testCases.testName: Combined clinical pattern - proximal M1 with lenticulostriate
testCases.description: Both proximal M1 and lenticulostriate patterns present

expectedOutputs.Regions Affected: 4 region(s): C (Caudate), L (Lentiform), IC (Internal Capsule), I (Insular)
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Involvement of both insular ribbon and lentiform nucleus suggests proximal M1 occlusion with poor collaterals; Caudate and internal capsule involvement may indicate lenticulostriate artery territory infarction

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: All 4 subcortical regions affected. Step 2: ASPECTS = 6. Step 3: Both proximal M1 and lenticulostriate patterns identified.
testCases.medicalReference: Combined patterns indicate proximal M1 occlusion affecting both cortical and lenticulostriate territories

subcortical.C: Caudate head - nuclei of the striatum
subcortical.L: Lentiform nucleus - putamen and globus pallidus
subcortical.IC: Internal capsule - posterior limb containing motor fibers
subcortical.I: Insular ribbon - insular cortex, early MCA stroke indicator

ganglionicCortical.M1: Frontal operculum - anterior MCA cortex at ganglionic level
ganglionicCortical.M2: Anterior temporal lobe - lateral to insular ribbon
ganglionicCortical.M3: Posterior temporal lobe - posterior MCA cortex at ganglionic level

supraganglionicCortical.M4: Anterior MCA territory - immediately superior to M1
supraganglionicCortical.M5: Lateral MCA territory - immediately superior to M2
supraganglionicCortical.M6: Posterior MCA territory - immediately superior to M3

scoringInterpretation.10: No early ischemic changes - ideal EVT candidate
scoringInterpretation.8-9: Small ischemic changes - good EVT candidate
scoringInterpretation.6-7: Moderate changes - meets standard EVT threshold (ASPECTS >= 6)
scoringInterpretation.3-5: Large core - consider per SELECT2/ANGEL-ASPECT/RESCUE-Japan LIMIT
scoringInterpretation.0-2: Very large core - historically excluded, individualized decision

standard.trials: MR CLEAN, ESCAPE, SWIFT PRIME, EXTEND-IA, REVASCAT (2015)

notes: ASPECTS is calculated by subtracting 1 point from 10 for each affected region
All 10 regions are assessed at the level of the basal ganglia and immediately above
Early ischemic changes include: hypodensity, loss of gray-white differentiation, sulcal effacement
ASPECTS applies only to MCA territory strokes - use pc-ASPECTS for posterior circulation
Insular ribbon sign is often the earliest CT finding in MCA stroke
Combined insular + lentiform involvement suggests proximal M1 occlusion with poor collaterals
Caudate + internal capsule involvement suggests lenticulostriate territory infarction
Complete cortical (M1-M6) involvement indicates very poor collateral circulation
ASPECTS >= 6 was the standard threshold for EVT in 2015 landmark trials
Large core trials (SELECT2, ANGEL-ASPECT) extended EVT benefit to ASPECTS 3-5 in 2022-2023
Time window assessment requires integration with clinical and perfusion imaging data
